alert.note: Alert for Lebanon; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:37AM EST until further notice by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek At Harper Tavern affecting Lebanon and Schuylkill Counties. For the Swatara Creek...including Harper Tavern, Middletown, Hershey, Middletown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, A number of secondary roads are closed, resulting in some evacuations. A few homes are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.1 feet. - The river will reach bankfull this morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 11.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 02/08/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EST.
